channel.title: Coding on instantiator.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Coding on instantiator.dev

item.title: Bucket List - the bucket that wouldn't die
item.description: In which I present a short 3-act play about emptying a bucket, and a handy script to make it easy.

item.title: Building an app for Flipper Zero, part 2: A simple user interface
item.description: In this part, we’ll build a simple user interface for a Flipper Zero app.

item.title: Building an app for Flipper Zero, part 1: Getting started
item.description: FlipperZero is a digital signals multi-tool. Here’s a short guide to the basics of building an app for it…

item.title: Building AI into your application with Semantic Kernel
item.description: This is a quick guide to some of the features of the Semantic Kernel, a Software Development Kit that simplifies integration of language models into your own applications.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 6: Triggers
item.description: In part 5, we amended our Lambda to write to an S3 bucket; and in this part, we’ll explore triggers to run it regularly.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 5: S3
item.description: In previous parts, we’ve built a Lambda that can query the OpenWeather API, using a secret key; and in this part we’ll extend it to write that data to S3.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 4: Logs
item.description: In part 3, we extended our Lambda to communicate with an API, using a secret key; and in this part, we’ll explore the logs created when the Lambda runs.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 3: APIs and secrets
item.description: In part 2, we build a Lambda function, deployed and invoked it; and in this part, we’ll extend it to communicate with an API using a secret key.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 2: Build, deploy and invoke
item.description: In part 1, we set up the basic infrastructure to support a new Lambda function on AWS; and n this part, we’ll build a Lambda function, deploy it to AWS, and invoke it with some input.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 1: AWS
item.description: At first glance, Amazon Web Services (AWS) can seem impenetrably complex, but it’s not so bad once you’ve found your way around it…

item.title: Choosing your first coding language
item.description:
Anyone can code.

This is a short exploration of the choices for coding beginners out there.

item.title: Hello, World!
item.description: I learned to code on a computer called the BBC Micro, released by the BBC in 1981. I was also released in 1981, and I have a bit of a bond with these 8-bit wonders.

item.title: Wriggler
item.description:
This is a necropost, resurrected from an old blog.

Wriggler

It was 1998 and I was 17. My tool of choice was QBasic and this is a game I wrote based on a concept I stole from another game called Wriggler.
